meanings.definition: To sell goods or services in small quantities, typically door-to-door or on the street.
meanings.sent1: She was peddling handmade jewelry in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The street vendor was peddling fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: Peddling her wares with a smile, she brightened up the block.
meanings.sent4: The idea of kindness was peddled like a precious gem in her speeches.
meanings.sent5: Peddling goods under the sun, she felt the joy of entrepreneurship.

meanings.definition: To spread (an idea or belief) widely or indiscriminately.
meanings.sent1: He was peddling conspiracy theories online.
meanings.sent2: The politician was peddling promises of change to the crowd.
meanings.sent3: Peddling rumors like a mischievous squirrel, he caused chaos in the town.
meanings.sent4: The notion of peace was peddled through the art exhibition.
meanings.sent5: Peddling hope in times of despair, she became a beacon of light.
